meanings.definition: Vulcanised: (verb) to treat rubber or other materials with sulfur or other chemicals to improve elasticity and strength.
meanings.sent1: The factory vulcanised the rubber to make it more flexible.
meanings.sent2: After being vulcanised, the rubber became more durable.
meanings.sent3: Why did the rubber band refuse to stretch? Because it wasn't vulcanised!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like rubber vulcanised under pressure, becoming stronger with each challenge.
meanings.sent5: The process of vulcanising rubber involves enhancing its properties through chemical treatment.

meanings.definition: Vulcanised: (adjective) treated with sulfur or other chemicals to improve elasticity and strength.
meanings.sent1: The vulcanised rubber band snapped back into shape effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The vulcanised tires provided better grip on the wet road.
meanings.sent3: The bouncy ball was so vulcanised that it bounced all the way to the moon!
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt vulcanised, resilient and unbreakable after overcoming hardships.
meanings.sent5: The vulcanised material showed remarkable flexibility and durability compared to untreated rubber.
